intro: Hieracium mexicanum f. glabrescens, commonly known as the Mexican hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. This variety is distinguished by its reduced hairy covering, giving it a smoother appearance compared to other forms of Hieracium.
